attributes.action: A new Representation of the People Act
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: If a Prime Minister comes into office without having been elected to that position by the British people at the previous general election, then he or she must seek a mandate from the electorate within six months of coming into office. The only exception being in time of total war, when parliamentary democracy has been suspended, and there is a government of war-time coalition. Furthermore, should an elected politician change their politicial allegiance during their tenure of office, such an act will immediately prompt a by-election in order that their constituents can make a positive decision as to whether or not they wish that individual to continue to represent them.
